meanings.definition: The state or quality of being able to be differentiated.
meanings.sent1: Her differentiabilities in math and science made her a well-rounded student.
meanings.sent2: The teacher praised the students for their differentiabilities in solving complex problems.
meanings.sent3: The differentiabilities of the twins made it hard for others to tell them apart.
meanings.sent4: His differentiabilities in music and art shone brightly in the school talent show.
meanings.sent5: The differentiabilities of the flowers in the garden added a beautiful variety to the landscape.

meanings.definition: The ability to be distinguished or recognized as separate or distinct.
meanings.sent1: The differentiabilities of the two species of birds were evident in their unique songs.
meanings.sent2: The differentiabilities between the two paintings were subtle but noticeable to art experts.
meanings.sent3: The differentiabilities of the identical twins confused their friends at the costume party.
meanings.sent4: Her differentiabilities in fashion made her stand out in a crowd of similar styles.
meanings.sent5: The differentiabilities of the gemstones sparkled in the sunlight, each one unique and special.
